main event: On October 31, 1951, a ground-radar observation was made at Point Barrow, Alaska, lasting 3 minutes. A light was observed in the northeast just above the horizon, believed to be coming from a surface vessel.
interesting points: The observation was made by the Alaska National Guard.
No photographs were taken as part of the observation.
The observed object was determined to be a light, not a UFO, and was believed to be coming from a surface vessel.
There were no conclusive comments or conclusions regarding the nature of the observed light.
The manner of the object's course was described as straight.
sighted object: a light in the northeast sky
